channel.title: Kde4
channel.description:
After seeing a few little reviews and screenshots of KDE4, I decided to test it out for myself - You know, your own opinion matters the most and all that Jazz?
Well, it appears that KDE4 is no where near ready to be released, a few reasons I can think from the top of my head for issues that I hated / problems that I had straight away are:
[ul][li]The taskbar would just vanish when I tried to edit some Icon settings, thus prompting me to have to rm -rf ~/.kde4 and then restart my WM.[/li] [li]It's more visual than functional, they are trying too hard to make it eye-candy - The panel resizing is stupid and too sensitive, the rotating of files and icons is pointless, KDE4 on the whole is just too big, it takes up way too much space on my desktop - The title bars for applications are around 30 pixels. It's just stupid.[/li][/ul]
What exactly are your opinions on KDE4 so far? It will be good, when it is finished imo but as for the moment I think I'll be keeping KDE 3.5 :P.

item.title: Kde4
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

I agree, I think I am going to switch to debian, since they have packages for both (the way it should be)

Read full topic

item.title: Kde4
item.dc:creator: @R.I.P_RSC R.I.P RSC
item.description:
@R.I.P_RSC wrote:

Moparisthebest:

I have not even upgraded to the latest version of kubuntu because they force you to change to KDE4 and don’t offer a kde3 package even.

IMHO that’s just ruining the idea behind Linux: Complete control on the users’ side.

Read full topic

item.title: Kde4
item.dc:creator: @Mopman Mopman
item.description:
@Mopman wrote:

solarwind:

I build kde from source every day.

I’d imagine that takes a large part of your day O_O

Read full topic

item.title: Kde4
item.dc:creator: @solarwind solarwind
item.description:
@solarwind wrote:

Long time no posting.

I build kde from source every day. It always gets better. It’s slow, buggy but looks cool and very usable.

Read full topic

item.title: Kde4
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

I love KDE, always have. However I agree with you and am sticking with KDE 3.5 for now. I have not even upgraded to the latest version of kubuntu because they force you to change to KDE4 and don’t offer a kde3 package even. I think this is a bad move for them.

Read full topic

item.title: Kde4
item.dc:creator: @Ollie Ollie
item.description:
@Ollie wrote:

QFT

KDE is too much like vista, lots of un-needed shit.

Read full topic

item.title: Kde4
item.dc:creator: @R.I.P_RSC R.I.P RSC
item.description:
@R.I.P_RSC wrote:

They are going after Windows, I guess. More looks, less power.

Read full topic

item.title: Kde4
item.dc:creator: @eVokki1 Cowie`
item.description:
@eVokki1 wrote:

Now that I’ve woken up I decided I’d try it again, and it’s still to the same effect - if not any more annoying than it was this morning.

[ul][li]There is stupid sound effects as standard for minimizing, maximizing.[/li]
[li]The widget’s given aren’t as functional as you would expect[/li]
[li]The individual icon rotation / scaling / setting is useless function wise but is just there to make it easier on the eyes.[/li]
[li]The whole desktop is too bulky, I’m only on 1280x1024 but usually I can get some nice space from that - with the new KDE4 there is near to no space, [/li][li]the taskbar although resizable is still way too big.[/li]
[li]These little “perks” shouldn’t be here as default to annoy you, give the option to enable them with the setup it’s too annoying having to put up with them until you start the disabling process.[/li][/ul]

Read full topic

item.title: Kde4
item.dc:creator: @T41 t4
item.description:
@T41 wrote:

It’s unstable and way too flashy. They’re copying the new GUI hype - Makes me sad since my favorite is KDE. This is why I still use KDE 3.5 .

Read full topic
